abstract: The world’s largest aluminum producer, which is struggling under $17 billion in debt, appears to have negotiated favorable terms.
snippet: The world’s largest aluminum producer, which is struggling under $17 billion in debt, appears to have negotiated favorable terms.
lead_paragraph: MOSCOW  Rusal, the world’s largest aluminum producer, which is struggling under $17 billion in debt, is close to an agreement with about 70 banks to restructure its loans on terms considered favorable to the company and its billionaire owner, bankers said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Bankers Say Deal Is Near to Restructure Rusal’s Debt
headline.print_headline: Bankers Say Deal Is Near to Restructure Rusal’s Debt
